com.serotonin.mango.rt.event.type

Interface EventType.DuplicateHandling

  • Enclosing class:
    EventType

    public static interface EventType.DuplicateHandling
    This interface defines all of the possible actions that can occur if an event is raised for which type there already exists an active event.
    Author:
    Matthew Lohbihler

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ALLOW
      Duplicates are allowed.
      static int DO_NOT_ALLOW
      Duplicates are not allowed.
      static int IGNORE
      Duplicates are ignored.
      static int IGNORE_SAME_MESSAGE
      Duplicates are ignored only if their message is the same as the existing.

    • Field Detail

      • DO_NOT_ALLOW

        static final int DO_NOT_ALLOW
        Duplicates are not allowed. This should be the case for all event types where there is an automatic return to normal.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • IGNORE

        static final int IGNORE
        Duplicates are ignored. This should be the case where the initial occurrence of an event is really the only thing of interest to a user. For example, the initial error in a data source is usually what is most useful in diagnosing a problem.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • IGNORE_SAME_MESSAGE

        static final int IGNORE_SAME_MESSAGE
        Duplicates are ignored only if their message is the same as the existing.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ALLOW

        static final int ALLOW
        Duplicates are allowed. The change detector uses this so that user's can acknowledge every change the point experiences.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
